Since you're planning to go back to the same location, you might want to check the local weather forecast before your trip to get an idea of what to expect. You can check websites like weather.com, accuweather.com, or wunderground.com for the latest forecast.

It's also a good idea to be prepared for changing weather conditions, especially when hunting in the woods. Here are some tips to consider:

1. Pack layers: Bring clothing that can be layered, so you can adjust to changing temperatures.
2. Check the wind direction: If it's going to be windy, plan your hunt accordingly. Try to position yourself downwind of your target area to minimize scent detection.
3. Bring rain gear: Even if the forecast doesn't call for rain, it's always a good idea to bring a waterproof jacket or poncho, just in case.
4. Stay flexible: Be prepared to adjust your hunting plan if the weather changes. If it's too windy or rainy, you might need to wait for a better opportunity.
5. Pay attention to moon phases: The moon phase can affect deer behavior. A full moon can make deer more active at night, while a new moon can make them more active during the day.

Remember to always follow safe hunting practices, and I hope you have a successful and enjoyable hunt!
